com.hazelcast.nio.tcp.nonblocking

Interface SelectionHandler

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    MigratableHandler
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractClientSelectionHandler, AbstractHandler, ClientReadHandler, ClientWriteHandler, NonBlockingSocketReader, NonBlockingSocketWriter

    public interface SelectionHandler
    The SelectionHandler is a callback interface that gets called by an IO-thread when there data available to read, or space available to write.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void handle()
      Called when there are bytes available for reading, or space available to write.
      void onFailure(Throwable throwable)
      Is called when the handle() throws an exception.

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        void handle()
            throws Exception
        Called when there are bytes available for reading, or space available to write. Any exception that leads to a termination of the connection like an IOException should not be handled in the handle method but should be propagated. The reason behind this is that the handle logic already is complicated enough and by pulling it out the flow will be easier to understand.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • onFailure

        void onFailure(Throwable throwable)
        Is called when the handle() throws an exception. The idiom to use a handler is: try{ handler.handle(); } catch(Throwable t) { handler.onFailure(t); }
        Parameters:
        throwable -
